title: Super Version 5.1.0 (com.macjutsu.super)
description: Preference settings for S.U.P.E.R.M.A.N. update script. WARNING: Test Mode defaults to true. Please remember to set it to false before deploying. Full details on these settings can be found in the wiki: https://github.com/Macjutsu/super/wiki

AuthJamfComputerID.title: Auth Jamf Computer ID
AuthJamfComputerID.description: Use this when using super with Jamf Pro API account.

DeferralTimerDefault.title: Default Defer Timer
DeferralTimerDefault.description: The number of minutes to defer until the next update attempt if a user chooses not to update restart. It must be between 2 and 1440. Default deferral time is 60. Put X to diasble this option.

DeferralTimerFocus.title: Focus Defer Timer
DeferralTimerFocus.description: The number of minutes to defer the update restart dialog automatically if a process has prevented display sleep (for example, during an active meeting) or the user has Focus or Do Not Disturb enabled. It must be between 2 and 1440. Put X to diasble this option.

DeferralTimerMenu.title: Menu Defer Timer
DeferralTimerMenu.description: Display a deferral time pop-up menu in the non-deadline update restart dialog that allows the user to overide the DeferralTimerDefault time. It must be between 2 and 1440. Put X to diable this option.

DeferralTimerWorkflowRelaunch.title: Workflow Relaunch Defer Timer
DeferralTimerWorkflowRelaunch.description: The number of minutes to defer if no software updates are found. It must be between 2 and 43804. Put X to diable this option.

DeferralTimerError.title: Error Defer Timer
DeferralTimerError.description: The number of minutes to defer if super detects an error in the workflow (for example, network or MDM connectivity issues). It must be between 2 and 1440. Default deferral time is 60. Put X to diasble this option.

ScheduledInstallDays.title: Scheduled Install Days
ScheduledInstallDays.description: Allows you to specify the number of days after the zero date that a scheduled installation takes place.

ScheduledInstallDate.title: Scheduled Install Date
ScheduledInstallDate.description: Allows you to specify a date and time that a scheduled installation takes place.

ScheduledInstallUserChoice.title: Scheduled Install User Choice
ScheduledInstallUserChoice.description: Adds a Schedule button to the standard deferral dialog. When clicked, this button opens a scheduled installation dialog that allows the user to select a date and time for installation. If any day or date deadlines are also specified, then the user is not allowed to select an installation date later than the soonest deadline.

ScheduledInstallReminder.title: Scheduled Install Reminder
ScheduledInstallReminder.description: Allows you to specify a list of minutes separated by commas (no spaces) that define how often a scheduled installation reminder dialog appears prior to a scheduled installation.

DeadlineCountFocus.title: Focus Count Deadline
DeadlineCountFocus.description: The maximum number of automatic deferrals allowed if the system is in user-enabled Focus/Do Not Disturb or when a process has requested that the display not go to sleep (for example, during an active meeting). Put X to diable this option.

DeadlineCountSoft.title: Soft Count Deadline
DeadlineCountSoft.description: The maximum number of user selected deferrals allowed before the soft deadline automatically restarts for updates without asking the user for approval. Put X to diable this option.

DeadlineCountHard.title: Hard Count Deadline
DeadlineCountHard.description: The maximum number of user selected deferrals allowed before the computer automatically restarts for updates without asking the user for approval. Put X to diable this option.

DeadlineDaysFocus.title: Focus Days Deadline
DeadlineDaysFocus.description: The maximum number of days that automatic deferrals are allowed if the system is in user-enabled Focus/Do Not Disturb or when a process has requested that the display not go to sleep (for example, during an active meeting). Put X to diable this option.

DeadlineDaysSoft.title: Soft Days Deadline
DeadlineDaysSoft.description: The maximum number of days allowed before the soft deadline dialog. The soft deadline is an interactive update restart dialog indicating that no more deferrals are allowed. Put X to diable this option.

DeadlineDaysHard.title: Hard Days Deadline
DeadlineDaysHard.description: The maximum number of days allowed before the computer automatically restarts for updates without asking the user for approval. Put X to diable this option.

ScheduleWorkflowActive.title: Schedule Workflow Active
ScheduleWorkflowActive.description: allows you to define multiple weekday time frames that specify when the super workflow is allowed to be active (aka maintenance windows). Each schedule workflow active time frame must be specified using the following format DAY:hh:mm-hh:mm where weekdays are defined as MON|TUE|WED|THU|FRI|SAT|SUN and times are in 24-hour format. Multiple ranges are separated by a comma with no spaces.

ScheduleDeferredStartFile.title: Schedule Deferred Start File
ScheduleDeferredStartFile.description: Requires a local path to a file that automatically defers the workflow if the specified file is not found. This allows for super to be safely installed during extended macOS onboarding workflows (like Jamf Setup Manager, Setup-Your-Mac, SplashBuddy, etc.), as it will automatically defer based on the DeferralTimerDefault option or the default of 60 minutes.

ScheduleDeferredStartDays.title: Schedule Deferred Start Days
ScheduleDeferredStartDays.description: Automatically defers the workflow until the specified number of days has passed since the zero date. Simliar to the native macOS update/upgrade deferral mechanism, this option prevents super from interrupting the user (or if there is no user, from automatically installing) until after the deferred start number of days has passed.

ScheduleZeroDateManual.title: Manual Zero Day Workflow Date
ScheduleZeroDateManual.description: Instead of having the days deadline counter, automatically select the day zero date. PutX to diable this option.

ScheduleZeroDateRelease.title: Apple Zero Day Workflow Date
ScheduleZeroDateRelease.description: Leverages the public MacAdmin's SOFA macOS machine readable JSON feed to discover release dates for use in workflows with deadline day options.

ScheduleZeroDateSOFACustomURL.title: Apple Zero Day Custom URL
ScheduleZeroDateSOFACustomURL.description: Allows for a custom self-hosted MacAdmin's SOFA macOS machine readable JSON feed.

DeadlineDateFocus.title: Focus Date Deadline
DeadlineDateFocus.description: This is the last date and time when automatic deferrals are allowed if the system is in user-enabled Focus/Do Not Disturb or when a process has requested that the display not go to sleep (for example, during an active meeting). Put X to diable this option.

DeadlineDateSoft.title: Soft Date Deadline
DeadlineDateSoft.description: If this date and time have passed, an interactive update restart dialog appears indicating that no more user deferrals are allowed. Put X to disable this option.

DeadlineDateHard.title: Hard Date Deadline
DeadlineDateHard.description: If this date has passed, the computer restarts and udpates without asking the user for approval. Put X to diable this option.

DialogTimeoutDefault.title: Default Dialog Timeout
DialogTimeoutDefault.description: Sets the default timeout for any dialog that doesn't have a specific timeout setting

DialogTimeoutUserChoice.title: User Choice Restart or Defer Display Timeout
DialogTimeoutUserChoice.description: Sets an automatic timeout for interactive update restart dialogs in seconds. The countdown of the timeout is displayed in the update restart dialog. Put X to diable this option.

DialogTimeoutUserSchedule.title: User Choice Dialog Schedule
DialogTimeoutUserSchedule.description: Sets an automatic timeout for interactive update restart dialogs in seconds. The countdown of the timeout is displayed in the update restart dialog. Put X to diable this option.

DialogTimeoutSoftDeadline.title: Soft Display Timeout
DialogTimeoutSoftDeadline.description: Sets an automatic timeout for interactive update restart dialogs in seconds. The countdown of the timeout is displayed in the update restart dialog. Put X to diable this option.

DisplayUnmovable.title: Display Unmovable Dialogs and Notifications
DisplayUnmovable.description: Prevents the user from moving dialogs and notifications. Put X to diable this option.

DisplayHideBackground.title: Display Hide Background
DisplayHideBackground.description: Hide the background while displaying super dialogs and notifications. Using this option hides all other windows (including full screen mode) and the background via blur effect while displaying super dialogs and notifications. Put X to diable this option.

DisplayHideProgressBar.title: Display Hide Progress Bar
DisplayHideProgressBar.description: This option hides the animated progress bar (as opposed showing it) for notifications and alerts. Put X to diable this option.

DisplayNotificationsCentered.title: Display Notifications Centered
DisplayNotificationsCentered.description: Shows non-interactive notifications in the center of the screen as opposed to the top right. Put X to diable this option.

DisplayIconFile.title: Display Icon
DisplayIconFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the picture to display in notifications or dialogs. This remains as a default icon option and as a fail-over if the user's appearance mode cannot be resolved when Light or Dark icon files are configured. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayIconLightFile.title: Light Display Icon
DisplayIconLightFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the picture to display in notifications or dialogs when in light mode. Failover to DisplayIconFile payload if configured. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayIconDarkFile.title: Dark Display Icon
DisplayIconDarkFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the picture to display in notifications or dialogs when in dark mode. Failover to DisplayIconFile payload if configured. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayIconSize.title: Icon Size
DisplayIconSize.description: Number of pixels for the DisplayIcon in IBM Notifier dialogs. The value must be in between 96 and 150. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayAccessoryType.title: Custom Display Accessory
DisplayAccessoryType.description: Interactive dialogs (but not notifications) generated by IBM Notifier can be easily customized via several display accessory options. The display accessory content appears below any deferral or deadline text but above any interactive item like the deferral pop-up menu or user authentication field. Put X to disable this option.

DisplayAccessoryDefaultFile.title: Default Accessory File
DisplayAccessoryDefaultFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the default accessory. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayAccessoryMacOSMinorUpdateFile.title: Minor Updates Updates Accessory File
DisplayAccessoryMacOSMinorUpdateFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the accessory to display when performing macOS updates. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayAccessoryMacOSMajorUpgradeFile.title: Major Upgrades Accessory File
DisplayAccessoryMacOSMajorUpgradeFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the accessory to display when performing macOS upgrades. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayAccessoryNonSystemUpdatesFile.title: Non-System Updates Accessory File
DisplayAccessoryNonSystemUpdatesFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the accessory to display when the InstallNonSystemUpdatesWithoutRestarting payload option is also enabled and the workflow target is only non-system updates. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayAccessorySafariUpdateFile.title: Safari Updates Accessory File
DisplayAccessorySafariUpdateFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the accessory to display when the InstallSafariUpdateWithoutRestarting payload option is also enabled and the workflow target is only non-system updates. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayAccessoryJamfPolicyTriggersFile.title: Jamf Policy Accessory File
DisplayAccessoryJamfPolicyTriggersFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the accessory to display when the InstallJamfPolicyTriggers payload option is also enabled and the workflow target is only Jamf Pro Policy Triggers. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayAccessoryRestartWithoutUpdatesFil.title: Restart Without Updates Accessory File
DisplayAccessoryRestartWithoutUpdatesFil.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the accessory to display when the WorkflowRestartWithoutUpdates payload option is also enabled and the workflow target is only a forced restart without any updates. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayHelpButtonString.title: Help Button
DisplayHelpButtonString.description: Plain text to display or http(s) URL link to follow for the Help Button. Put X to disable this option.

DisplayWarningButtonString.title: Warning Button
DisplayWarningButtonString.description: Plain text or http(s) URL link to follow for the Warning Button. Put X to disable this option.

DisplaySilently.title: Display Dialogs Silently
DisplaySilently.description: When enabled, the system alert sound is suppressed when displaying dialogs.

DialogTimeoutUserAuth.title: User Authentication Timeout
DialogTimeoutUserAuth.description: On Mac computers with Apple Silicon, the number of seconds to wait for the user to successfully authenticate when presented with the user authenticated dialog. This dialog does not show a visual countdown of the timeout. Default time is 3600seconds (1 hour).

AuthJamfCustomURL.title: Jamf Custom URL Override
AuthJamfCustomURL.description: Allows you to override the default Jamf Pro management URL for a custom Jamf Pro API URL.

AuthAskUserToSavePassword.title: Authentication Ask User to Save Password
AuthAskUserToSavePassword.description: Prompt the end user to save their password which can then be used to authenticate the local softwareupdate command.

ConfigCodeSignature.title: Config Code Signature
ConfigCodeSignature.description: Enforces the use of code signed alternate configuration preference files. If this key is present then the super workflow will only accept alternate configuration preference files that are code signed and match the specified identifier. Both Apple Bundle and Apple Team identifiers are supported.

ConfigCodeSignature.title: Config Code Signature
ConfigCodeSignature.description: Enforces the use of code signed alternate configuration preference files. If this key is present then the super workflow will only accept alternate configuration preference files that are code signed and match the specified identifier. Both Apple Bundle and Apple Team identifiers are supported.

ConfigTempOverride.title: Allow Temporary Configuration Overrides
ConfigTempOverride.description: Allows temporary alternate workflow settings (started via the --config-start-temp=ConfigurationName option) to override conflicting managed preferences.

AuthMDMFailoverToUser.title: User Authentication MDM Failover
AuthMDMFailoverToUser.description: The MDM workflow can be unreliable due to its complexity, and super will automatically try again upon failure, however this settings allows super to try other options. For more information see https://github.com/Macjutsu/super/wiki/Apple-Silicon-Jamf-Pro-API-Credentials#user-authentication-mdm-failover. Put X to diable this option.

AuthCredentialFailoverToUser.title: Credential Authentication Failover To User
AuthCredentialFailoverToUser.description: If any managed automatic authentication method fails validation, then failover to local end user authentication.

InstallMacOSMajorUpgrades.title: Enforce macOS Upgrades
InstallMacOSMajorUpgrades.description: macOS now presents some Upgrades options as updates, super detects and ignores them by default (objective update over upgrade). Enabling this setting will allow the upgrades.

InstallMacOSMajorVersionTarget.title: Target Major Upgrade Version
InstallMacOSMajorVersionTarget.description: This setting option allows you to target specific macOS major upgrades (for example, 15.6.1). Note that targeting specific major upgrades that are not the latest version is very likely to require full macOS installer downloads.

InstallMacOSMinorVersionTarget.title: Target Minor Update Version
InstallMacOSMinorVersionTarget.description: This setting option allows you to target specific macOS minor updates (for example, 15.6.1). Note that targeting specific major upgrades that are not the latest version is very likely to require full macOS installer downloads.

InstallMacOSBSIUpdates.title: Allow Background Security Improvements
InstallMacOSBSIUpdates.description: macOS 26.1 Tahoe supports Background Security Improvement updates, which super will ignore if this is not enabled. super will ignore this setting on older macOS versions. Presently this new option only represents a name change as the underlying mechanism for macOS BSI updates appears to be similar to the legacy macOS Rapid Security Responses. The InstallRapidSecurityResponses option remains but is deprecated and will be removed in a future version of super.

InstallRapidSecurityResponses.title: Allow Rapid Security Response Updates
InstallRapidSecurityResponses.description: macOS 13.3+ Ventura support Rapid Security Response updates, which super will ignore if this is not enabled. super will ignore this setting on older macOS versions.

InstallNonSystemUpdatesWithoutRestarting.title: Enforce Non-System Updates
InstallNonSystemUpdatesWithoutRestarting.description: If you don't want the super workflow to wait for a macOS update to also install non-system Apple software updates, then you can enforce those non-system updates as soon as they become available.

InstallSafariUpdatesWithoutRestarting.title: Enforce Safari-only Updates
InstallSafariUpdatesWithoutRestarting.description: Target Safari updates for installation without restarting the system. This is a counter-option to Enforce Non-System Updates (InstallNonSystemUpdatesWithoutRestarting) option that targets all non-system updates for installation without restarting the system. This option is also unique in that if Safari is not active, then the workflow installs the Safari update automatically with no user interaction.

InstallPrioritizeNonRestartUpdates.title: Prioritize Non-Restart Updates
InstallPrioritizeNonRestartUpdates.description: This option works with either the Enforce Safari-only Updates (InstallSafariUpdateWithoutRestarting) or the Enforce Non-System Updates (InstallNonSystemUpdatesWithoutRestarting) option to prioritize non-system updates before any other potential workflows. In other words, even if a macOS update or upgrade is possible, this option forces the super workflow to target non-system updates for installation first. After the appropriate non-system items are installed, then the next time (based on the relaunch deferral timer) the super workflow runs, it reverts to the default targeting behavior.

WorkflowOnlyDownload.title: Only Download Updates
WorkflowOnlyDownload.description: Download and prepare any available macOS updates but do not start any installation workflow. This super option is designed to work along with the --install-now option to significantly reduce the user experience wait time for user-initiated macOS update workflows.

DialogTimeoutInsufficientStorage.title: Test Free Space Timeout
DialogTimeoutInsufficientStorage.description: Timeout for computers with not enough free space.

DialogTimeoutPowerRequired.title: Battery Timeout
DialogTimeoutPowerRequired.description: Timeout for computers where power is required.

InstallJamfPolicyTriggers.title: Install Jamf Policy Triggers
InstallJamfPolicyTriggers.description: If a restart is required for system updates or forced via RestartWithoutUpdates, this list of Jamf Policy Triggers runs before any available updates install and the computer restarts.

InstallJamfPolicyTriggersWithoutRestarti.title: Install Jamf Policies Without A Restart
InstallJamfPolicyTriggersWithoutRestarti.description: Allows for installation of Jamf Pro Policies even if there are no available macOS updates/upgrades.

WorkflowInstallNow.title: Start super workflow immediately
WorkflowInstallNow.description: Kicks off the super workflow immediately, prompting user that an update has begun.

WorkflowDisableUpdateCheck.title: Skip Updates
WorkflowDisableUpdateCheck.description: Skip Apple software updates, even if they are available.

WorkflowDisableRelaunch.title: Disable Super Auto-Relaunch
WorkflowDisableRelaunch.description: Prevents super from checking for new updates/upgrades on a reoccurring basis.

WorkflowRequireActiveUser.title: Require Active Logged In User
WorkflowRequireActiveUser.description: Super will only continue if there is a logged in user. With this option enabled, if there is no active user when the super workflow runs, then an automatic error deferral will restart the workflow for later.

WorkflowRestartWithoutUpdates.title: Restart Without Updates
WorkflowRestartWithoutUpdates.description: Force a restart even if Apple software updates do not need it.

TestMode.title: Test Mode
TestMode.description: Mode to validate parameters, credentials, notifications, dialogs, deferrals, and deadline logic.

TestModeTimeout.title: Test Mode Timeout
TestModeTimeout.description: The amount of time in seconds to leave test notifications and dialogs open before moving on in the workflow.

VerboseMode.title: Verbose Mode
VerboseMode.description: Mode to generate additional log output.
